Name: James Madison

Note: First official inaugural parade and the first inaugural ball

Name: James Madison

Note: During the middle of the war of 1812.

Name: James Monroe
Label: 's First Inaugural Address
Note: First fully outdoor inauguration.

Name: James Monroe
Label: 's Second Inaugural Address
Note: First inauguration delayed to avoid Sunday ceremony; ceremony moved indoors due to poor weather.

Name: John Quincy Adams
Label: 's Inaugural Address
Note: First son of a former president; first president to wear long pants, instead of knickers at his inauguration.

Name: Andrew Jackson
Label: 's First Inaugural Address
Note: First inauguation at Capitols East Portico featured the wildest inauguration party.

Name: Andrew Jackson
Label: 's Second Inaugural Address
Note: Ceremony moved indoors and inaugural parade cancelled due to poor weather.

Name: Martin Van Buren
Label: 's Inaugural Address
Note: First American president born as an American citizen.  First time old and new presidents rode together to Capitol ceremony.

Name: William Henry Harrison
Label: 's Inaugural Address
Note: Longest address, caught pneumonia, died one month later.

Name: John Tyler
Note: First vice president to succeed to presidency upon death of predecessor; No inaugural address.

Name: James K. Polk
Label: 's Inaugural Address
Note: First inauguration reported by telegraph.

Name: Zachary Taylor
Label: 's Inaugural Address
Note: Inauguration delayed one day to Monday.

Name: Millard Fillmore
Note: Oath administered by same subsitute justice who had sworn in John Tyler; No inaugural address.

Name: Franklin Pierce
Label: 's Inaugural Address
Note: Only President to affirm the oath; memorized his inaugural address.

Name: James Buchanan
Label: 's Inaugural Address
Note: First inauguration to be photographed.

Name: Abraham Lincoln
Label: 's First Inaugural Address
Note: Massive military presence at inauguration.

Name: Abraham Lincoln
Label: 's Second Inaugural Address
Note: "With Malice toward none, and charity to all"; first inaugural parade to include African Americans

Name: Andrew Johnson
Label: 's Inaugural Address
Note: Delivered his VP speech while drunk, just 42 days earlier; No inaugural address.

Name: Ulysses S. Grant
Label: 's First Inaugural Address
Note: Much patriotic enthusiasm for the first inauguration post Civil War

Name: Ulysses S. Grant
Label: 's Second Inaugural Address
Note: 2nd coldest inaugural; first presidential review stand; frozen food at inaugural ball

Name: Rutherford B. Hayes
Label: 's Inaugural Address
Note: Only President to be sworn in a day early, privately at White House

Name: James A. Garfield
Label: 's Inaugural Address
Note: First inauguration attended by the mother of a president; first inaugural parade reviewing stand in front of White House

Name: Chester A. Arthur
Note: Only president to be sworn in at his own home; No inaugural address.

Name: Grover Cleveland
Label: 's First Inaugural Address
Note: Only president to serve two non consecutive terms

Name: Benjamin Harrison
Label: 's Inaugural Address
Note: Outgoing President Cleveland held umbrella over Harrison during rainy ceremony

Name: Grover Cleveland
Label: 's  Second Inaugural Address
Note: Only president to serve two non consecutive terms

Name: William McKinley
Label: 's First Inaugural Address
Note: First inauguration to be filmed and recorded with sound

Name: William McKinley
Label: 's Second Inaugural Address
Note: Recent war hero Theodore Roosevelt new vice president

Name: Theodore Roosevelt
Note: Inauguration of nation's youngest president, age 42; No inaugural address.

Name: Theodore Roosevelt
Label: 's Inaugural Address
Note: Most colorful inaugural parade in history

Name: William Howard Taft
Label: 's Inaugural Address
Note: First time president and first lady rode together back to White House after ceremony

Name: Woodrow Wilson
Label: 's First Inaugural Address
Note: Era of no inaugural balls begins

Name: Woodrow Wilson
Label: 's Second Inaugural Address
Note: First private oath taken on a Sunday

Name: Warren G. Harding
Label: 's Inaugural Address
Note: First time president to ride to inauguration in an automobile; first time loudspeakers used at inauguration ceremony

Name: Calvin Coolidge
Note: Oath aministered by President's father; took oath a second time to legitimize ceremony weeks later; No inaugural address.

Name: Calvin Coolidge
Label: 's Inaugural Address
Note: First inauguration to be broadcast on live radio

Name: Herbert Hoover
Label: 's Inaugural Address
Note: First inauguration to be broadcast on sound newsreel

Name: Franklin D. Roosevelt
Label: 's First Inaugural Address
Note: The only thing we have to fear, is fear itself.

Name: Franklin D. Roosevelt
Label: 's Second Inaugural Address
Note: The First January 20th ceremony

Name: Franklin D. Roosevelt
Label: 's Third Inaugural Address
Note: First president to be elected to three terms in office

Name: Franklin D. Roosevelt
Label: 's Fourth Inaugural Address
Note: Low key inauguration held on White House balcony during World War

Name: Harry S. Truman
Note: First new president in more than 12 years; No inaugural address.

Name: Harry S. Truman
Label: 's  Inaugural Address
Note: First televised inauguration

Name: Dwight D. Eisenhower
Label: 's First Inaugural Address
Note: Longest inaugural parade

Name: Dwight D. Eisenhower
Label: 's Second Inaugural Address
Note: Private Sunday ceremony at White House

Name: John F. Kennedy
Label: 's Inaugural Address
Note: Ask not what you can do for your country; first time both parents withnessed their son's inauguration

Name: Lyndon B. Johnson
Note: Only time a president has been sworn in by a woman.  No inaugural address.

Name: Lyndon B. Johnson
Label: 's Inaugural Address
Note: First lady held Bible during oath for first time

Name: Richard Nixon
Label: 's First Inaugural Address
Note: First inaugural parade disrupted by protestors

Name: Richard Nixon
Label: 's Second Inaugural Address
Note: Second  inaugural parade disrupted by protestors

Name: Gerald R. Ford
Note: First inauguration of someone never elected either president or vice-president; No inaugural address.

Name: Jimmy Carter
Label: 's Inaugural Address
Note: Only president to use a nickname when taking the formal oath

Name: Ronald Reagan
Label: 's First Inaugural Address
Note: "Government is not the solution to our problem; government is the problem"; First inauguration on Capitol's west side

Name: Ronald Reagan
Label: 's Second Inaugural Address
Note: Sunday ceremony at White House

Name: George H. W. Bush
Label: 's Inaugural Address
Note: Called inauguration "Democracy's Big Day"

Name: Bill Clinton
Label: 's First Inaugural Address
Note: First president to attend inaugural morning services at a predominantly African American church.

Name: Bill Clinton

Note: First inauguration broadcast live over Internet

Label: 's First Inaugural Address
Note: Father George bcame first former president to personally witness the inauguration of his son

Name: George W. Bush

Note: First time a protest took place during the inaugural oath

Note: First inauguration of an African American preident; largest attendance

Note: Oath of office misstated & administered next day
